newFeatures.name: Sugerencias de código para CSS más inteligentes
newFeatures.description: Las sugerencias de Código para CSS ahora utilizan el mismo algoritmo de correspondencia de cadenas que la Apertura Rápida y las sugerencias de código para JavaScript. Por ejemplo, si escribe "blc" obtendrá la sugerencia "border-left-color".

newFeatures.name: Notificaciones de actualizaciones de extensiones
newFeatures.description: El icono en la barra de herramientas para el Administrador de Extensiones ahora cambia a color verde indicando que hay una o más extensiones que tienen actualizaciones esperando a ser instaladas.

newFeatures.name: Nuevo menú Buscar
newFeatures.description: Los comandos de Búsqueda se movieron desde el menú Edición a un nuevo menú Buscar para reducir el tamaño del menú Edición y que sean más fáciles de ubicar.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras en la Edición
newFeatures.description: Cortar y Copiar ahora cortará o copiará la línea entera donde está ubicado el cursor cuando no hay nada seleccionado. También funciona con múltiples cursores.

newFeatures.name: Manejo de archivos binarios en Windows y Linux
newFeatures.description: La apertura de un archivo binario o de otros archivos no codificados con UTF8 en Linux y Windows ahora tendrá como resultado un mensaje de error en lugar de texto confuso, y las búsqueda en archivos omitirá esos archivos, mejorando el rendimiento. Esto coincide con el comportamiento existente Mac.

newFeatures.name: Mapee nombres de archivos y extensiones a un lenguaje de programación
newFeatures.description: Ahora podrá agregar una preferencia para ajustar el resaltado de sintaxis del editor y otras características del lenguaje de programación para los archivos basados en un nombre de archivo o extensión.

newFeatures.name: Traducción al Croata
newFeatures.description: Brackets tiene una nueva traducción al Croata realizada por la comunidad.

newFeatures.name: Múltiples cursores y selecciones
newFeatures.description: Cree múltiples cursores, selecciones discontinuas, y selecciones rectangulares para realizar ediciones similares en varios lugares al mismo tiempo.

newFeatures.name: Agregar coincidencias a la selección
newFeatures.description: Rápidamente agregue la siguiente instancia de la palabra o rango seleccionado a la selección múltiple con ⌘B/Ctrl+B, o agregue todas las instancias con ⌘⌃G/Alt-F3. Muy útil para renombrar.

newFeatures.name: Deshacer selección
newFeatures.description: Deshaga el último cambio o edición sobre la selección múltiple con ⌘U/Ctrl+U, y rehaga con ⌘⇧U/Ctrl+Shift+U. Esto es útil para corregir un error en la selección múltiple o para saltar a la ubicación de una selección anterior.

newFeatures.name: Colapsar todos los hijos
newFeatures.description: Use ⌘⌥Click/Ctrl+Alt+Click para colapsar todos los hijos de la carpeta seleccionada en el árbol de archivos.

newFeatures.name: Devolución de resultados en la Edición rápida
newFeatures.description: La Edición Rápida (⌘E/Ctrl+E) y la Documentación Rápida (⌘K/Ctrl+K) ahora mostrarán información útil cuando se invocan en elementos de código que no admiten los comandos.

newFeatures.name: Soporte para archivos .ico en la Vista previa de imágenes
newFeatures.description: Ahora puede seleccionar archivos con formato .ico desde el árbol de directorios para ver una vista previa de los mismos.

newFeatures.name: API para sugerencias de código asincrónico
newFeatures.description: Los códigos para las sugerencias de código ahora pueden devolver los resultados de forma asincrónica, mejorando la capacidad de respuesta y el rendimiento.

newFeatures.name: Excluir archivos/carpetas en la Búsqueda en archivos
newFeatures.description: Especifique nombres de archivos y carpetas o comodines para excluir en múltiples búsquedas.

newFeatures.name: Instaladores firmados para Mac y Windows
newFeatures.description: El instalador de Brackets ahora esta firmado en Mac y Windows, haciendo que la instalación y las actualizaciones sean más fáciles.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras en la infraestructura de las preferencias
newFeatures.description: El nuevo API para las Preferencias ahora esta listo para ser usado por las extensiones. Además, se agregaron nuevas preferencias: mire http://is.gd/BracketsPrefs para la documentación.

newFeatures.name: Instale extensiones por proxies
newFeatures.description: Ahora puede setear el "proxy" por medio de las preferencias para habilitar a Brackets a instalar extensiones por detrás de un servidor proxy. Mire http://is.gd/BracketsPrefs para más información.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras en la Edición rápida para funciones de temporización
newFeatures.description: Ahora puede abrir la Edición Rápida en una función de temporización para animaciones incompleta (por ejemplo, "cubic-bezier()") para crear una curva bezier desde cero.

newFeatures.name: Interfaz para el modo sobreescritura
newFeatures.description: El cursor ahora cambia en el modo sobreescritura, y puede intercambiar entre el modo insertar y el modo sobreescritura desde la barra de estado.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras en el sistema de archivos y en la Vista previa en vivo
newFeatures.description: Se arreglaron errores críticos con cambios externos realizados sobre los archivos y errores en la Vista Previa en Vivo no arrancando correctamente.

newFeatures.name: Nuevas traducciones
newFeatures.description: Se agrego una traducción a indonesio.

newFeatures.name: Preferencias mejoradas
newFeatures.description: Utilice archivos de configuración con formato JSON para especificar la configuración por carpeta o tipo de archivo.

newFeatures.name: Mejorado el soporte para LESS
newFeatures.description: Las sugerencias de código CSS y la Documentación rápida ahora están disponibles al editar archivos LESS.

newFeatures.name: Sistema de archivos y rendimiento
newFeatures.description: El editor y el árbol de archivos del proyecto se actualizarán automáticamente con los cambios externos. Operaciones, tales como Buscar en archivos, son mucho más rápidas.

newFeatures.name: Extensiones
newFeatures.description: Hay un nuevo comando Desarrollo > Recargar sin extensiones para ayudar a solucionar problemas. Cuando se actualizan o remueven extensiones, Brackets se recargará automáticamente, por lo que salir y abrir Brackets nuevamente ya no es necesario.

newFeatures.name: Edición rápida para animation timing
newFeatures.description: Cuando el cursor esta sobre la función CSS steps(), puede usar la Edición rápida (Ctrl+E/⌘E) para editar los parámetros visualmente.

newFeatures.name: Actualizaciones en la interfaz en Windows
newFeatures.description: Se corrigieron muchos fallos en la ventana en Windows.

newFeatures.name: Inspección de código
newFeatures.description: Múltiples extensiones pueden registrar inspectores de código para el mismo tipo de archivo y todos los resultados se mostraran juntos en el mismo panel de resultados.

newFeatures.name: Nuevas traducciones
newFeatures.description: Nuevas traducciones de Griego y Coreano fueron agregadas a Brackets.

newFeatures.name: Nueva interfaz para buscar/reemplazar
newFeatures.description: Reemplazar ahora usa una interfaz más ágil y clara que soporta las mismas características que Buscar, incluyendo búsqueda incremental y resaltado de resultados. Fueron agregados nuevos botones en Buscar, Buscar en archivos y Reemplazar que permiten activar la sensibilidad a mayúsculas y las expresiones regulares en las búsquedas.

newFeatures.name: Activar Desarrollo en Vivo en Mac
newFeatures.description: En Mac, Chrome ahora no necesita ser reabierto cuando se activa Desarrollo en Vivo.

newFeatures.name: Brackets arranca más rápido
newFeatures.description: Brackets ahora carga hasta un 50% más rápido gracias a la minificación de los archivos JavaScript y a la pre-compilación de los archivos LESS.

newFeatures.name: Arreglo que evita que Brackets se congele al abrir archivos JavaScript
newFeatures.description: Arregla el problema #6067: Abrir archivos JavaScript en carpetas que contiene cierto tipo de archivos causaba que Brackets se congele.

newFeatures.name: Arreglo de problemas de interfaz con ciertos archivos LESS
newFeatures.description: Arregla el problema #6057: Abrir ciertos archivos LESS causaba que la interfaz del editor se volviera parcialmente blanca o mostrase otros problema técnicos.

newFeatures.name: Actualizar instalaciones existentes de Brackets
newFeatures.description: Las próximas versiones de Brackets, a partir de la versión Sprint 35, se actualizarán sobre la instalación existente de Brackets. Nota: Las versiones Sprint 33 y anteriores todavía pueden estar instaladas de manera simultánea o desinstaladas.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras gráficas
newFeatures.description: La versión de Mac tiene ahora una barra oscura, acorde con el resto del diseño de Brackets.

newFeatures.name: Robustez de las sugerencias de código en JavaScript
newFeatures.description: Solucionados los problemas por los que las sugerencias se perdían en archivos de tamaño medio (500-2000 líneas) y en casos en los que se modificaban las propiedades exportadas de un módulo.

newFeatures.name: Traducciones nuevas y actualizadas
newFeatures.description: Nuevas traducciones de Holandés, Persa y Rumano contribuidas por la comunidad. Las traducciones de Francés, Japonés, Portugués de Brasil, Checo, Finlandés, Alemán, Español y Sueco han sido actualizadas.

newFeatures.name: Mejorada la API del sistema de archivos
newFeatures.description: Los autores de extensiones pueden ahora construir extensiones más robustas y eficientes utilizando la actualizada API del sistema de archivos. Las notas de la versión incluyen los detalles importantes y las pautas de migración.

newFeatures.name: Vista previa de imágenes
newFeatures.description: Al seleccionar una imagen en el árbol de directorios se muestra una vista previa de la misma.

newFeatures.name: Nueva regla CSS desde Edición Rápida
newFeatures.description: Usa el botón Nueva Regla en la Edición Rápida de CSS (Ctrl+E/⌘E) para crear una regla para el tag/class/id seleccionado, incluso si todavía no hay reglas. Puedes modificar el selector una vez se haya creado.

newFeatures.name: Edición Rápida para Suavizado de Animaciones
newFeatures.description: Cuando la selección está en una "animation timing function" de CSS, puedes usar la Edición Rápida de CSS (Ctrl+E/⌘E) para modificar visualmente la curva de tiempo.

newFeatures.name: Reemplazar en Expresiones Regulares
newFeatures.description: Al utilizar una expresión regular en buscar/reemplazar, puedes usar $1, $2, etc. en la cadena de reemplazo para hacer referencia a expresiones entre paréntesis en la cadena de búsqueda.

newFeatures.name: Mejoras gráficas
newFeatures.description: Los widgets de Edición Gráfica tienen ahora un botón de cerrar. Buscar en archivos informa cuándo no hay resultados.

newFeatures.name: Traducciones actualizadas
newFeatures.description: Las traducciones de Francés, Japonés, Alemán, Checo y Español han sido actualizadas.

newFeatures.name: Launch Live Preview for non-HTML file
newFeatures.description: Brackets will automatically find a nearby index.html file to use. No more switching away from your CSS file to start Live Preview!

newFeatures.name: Faster Performance in Find as you Type
newFeatures.description: Initial keystrokes when typing in Find field (when the number of results is usually very high) are improved.

newFeatures.name: Update Node to Version 0.10
newFeatures.description: This is an 'Under the Hood' change.

newFeatures.name: Improved Linting API
newFeatures.description: Extension authors can now drive linting engine headlessly.

newFeatures.name: Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: French, Japanese, German, Czech, Finnish, and Turkish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: Live Preview for HTML
newFeatures.description: Live Preview updates in real time as you type in HTML files. Updates pause whenever the HTML is not syntactically valid.

newFeatures.name: Windows UI
newFeatures.description: Windows now has a dark titlebar. A similar change will be coming soon for Mac too.

newFeatures.name: Keyboard Support for Recent Projects
newFeatures.description: Press Ctrl+Alt+R (⌘⌥R) to open the 'recent projects' dropdown, then use the arrows and Enter to switch projects.

newFeatures.name: CSS Code Hints in SCSS
newFeatures.description: Code hints for CSS property names & values: The same code hints you see in CSS files will now also appear in SCSS files. Quick Docs for CSS properties: Ditto – just like in CSS.

newFeatures.name: HTML Matching Tag Highlighting
newFeatures.description: Highlight matching open/close tag.

newFeatures.name: Search
newFeatures.description: Update Find in Files results while typing.

newFeatures.name: Search Result Tickmarks
newFeatures.description: Find results are visually mapped out as yellow tickmarks along the scroll bar track.

newFeatures.name: OS X 10.6 Support Restored
newFeatures.description: Brackets will no longer crash on launch when running on Mac OS X 10.6.x.

newFeatures.name: Linux Preview Improvements & Fixes
newFeatures.description: File delete, Extension Manager and HTML Highlighting in Live Preview are now enabled. Also, we've fixed several bugs when installing the Debian package.

newFeatures.name: CSS Regions Named Flow Code Hints
newFeatures.description: Named Flows for CSS regions will now appear in code hints for flow-into and flow-from properties.

newFeatures.name: Function Parameter Hints
newFeatures.description: Hints appear automatically when you first type inside parentheses, or when invoked manually with Ctrl+Shift+Space.

newFeatures.name: Replace All
newFeatures.description: Replace All displays a panel showing all occurrences that will be replaced. You can review and uncheck any occurrences you don't want to replace.

newFeatures.name: Note: Theseus Extension Update Required
newFeatures.description: All users of the Theseus extension must update due to a break in compatibility. Also, Brackets developers can now use the Theseus to debug an instance of Brackets.

newFeatures.name: Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: The French, Japanese, German, and Turkish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: Note: Does Not Launch on OS X 10.6
newFeatures.description: Do not upgrade if you are running Mac OS X 10.6.x, as this sprint will not launch. We've tracked down the cause and hope to fix it in Sprint 30. In the meantime, if you are on Snow Leopard, use Sprint 26 or earlier.

newFeatures.name: Find in Files: View All Results and Add to Working Set
newFeatures.description: Find in Files now displays more than 100 results. You may double click on a result to add the file to the working set.

newFeatures.name: "Open With…" support for Finder (Mac only)
newFeatures.description: Brackets is now displayed in the "Open With…" Finder context menu for supported file types.

newFeatures.name: New Finnish Support and Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: A new Finnish translation has been created for Brackets. The French, Japanese, Czech, German, and Swedish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: Note: Does Not Launch on OS X 10.6
newFeatures.description: Do not upgrade if you are running Mac OS X 10.6.x, as Sprints 27 and 28 will not launch. We've tracked down the cause and hope to fix it in Sprint 29. In the meantime, if you are on Snow Leopard, use Sprint 26 or earlier.

newFeatures.name: New Untitled Document
newFeatures.description: File > New now creates a blank untitled document in memory, as in other text editors; you will be prompted for a filename on save. You can still directly create a new file on disk by choosing New File from the context menu in the file tree.

newFeatures.name: Install Extensions from Registry
newFeatures.description: The Extension Manager now has a tab that lists available extensions for Brackets. You can install an extension from the list or update to the latest version of an extension with a single click. Developers can upload extensions to the registry at brackets-registry.aboutweb.com.

newFeatures.name: Drag and Drop from OS
newFeatures.description: You can now drag files from the OS onto the Brackets window in order to open them. You can also drag a folder onto the Brackets window to open it in the sidebar.

newFeatures.name: Quick Edit and Quick View animations
newFeatures.description: Quick Edit views now animate open and closed, and the Quick View popup has a subtle grow effect.

newFeatures.name: OS X 10.6 Issue
newFeatures.description: Do not upgrade if you are running Mac OS X 10.6.x, as Sprint 27 fails to load. Newer versions of OS X are unaffected by this issue. We hope to fix this bug in Sprint 28. Sorry.

newFeatures.name: Save As
newFeatures.description: Save a copy of a file using the File > Save As… menu, project tree context menu, or with the keyboard shortcut Ctrl+Shift+S or ⇧⌘S.

newFeatures.name: Updated Quick View Gradient Support
newFeatures.description: Quick View for gradients now supports the "to" keyword for gradient direction and new repeating-linear-gradient and repeating-radial-gradient types.

newFeatures.name: New Hungarian Support and Language Updates
newFeatures.description: A new Hungarian translation has been created for Brackets. French, Czech and Spanish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: New Native Shell
newFeatures.description: Under the hood, Brackets is now using a new version of the Chromium Embedded Framework. There are no significant user-facing changes, but please do report bugs if you experience any problems.

newFeatures.name: Update Installed Extensions
newFeatures.description: Extension Manager can now update an installed extension without manually uninstalling the extension first.

newFeatures.name: New Status Bar Design
newFeatures.description: Visual updates to the status bar including new icons for JSLint validation.

newFeatures.name: Show/Hide JSLint Errors
newFeatures.description: When JSLint errors are present, click on the status icon in the status bar to show/hide the JSLint panel.

newFeatures.name: URL Hints in CSS
newFeatures.description: In an @import or url() statement, code hints will show relative paths to files in your project.

newFeatures.name: OK/Cancel Dialog Buttons on Windows
newFeatures.description: OK and Cancel buttons in dialogs now display in the correct order. Previously the order was reversed.

newFeatures.name: Architecture: jQuery, Bootstrap and LESS updates
newFeatures.description: Under the hood, Brackets is now using newer versions of jQuery, Bootstrap and LESS. There are no significant user-facing changes, but please do report bugs if you experience any problems.

newFeatures.name: Extension Manager
newFeatures.description: From the toolbar icon or File > Extension Manager… you can view, search and remove installed extensions. To install new extensions, use the Install from URL… button in the Extension Manager.

newFeatures.name: Delete Files/Folders
newFeatures.description: Files and folders can be deleted from the file tree using the context menu or File > Delete.

newFeatures.name: Show in OS
newFeatures.description: Right click on a file or folder and choose Show in OS to open the location in Mac Finder or Windows Explorer.

newFeatures.name: Refresh File Tree
newFeatures.description: Right-click on the file tree and choose Refresh to update the file list from disk.

newFeatures.name: Live Preview Reliability
newFeatures.description: On all platforms, if Live Preview is disconnected, Brackets will show a notification. On Windows, launching and finding Chrome is now more reliable.

newFeatures.name: JavaScript Code Intelligence Improvements
newFeatures.description: JavaScript Quick Edit now uses the Tern-based code intelligence engine for finding function definitions. Also, bug fixes and performance optimizations were made in JavaScript code hinting.

newFeatures.name: Typing Performance
newFeatures.description: A substantial typing performance regression has been fixed.

newFeatures.name: New Quick View
newFeatures.description: Use your mouse to hover over color, gradient and image values for an in-editor preview.

newFeatures.name: New Quick Docs for CSS
newFeatures.description: Press Ctrl+K or ⌘K on a CSS property to view community generated documentation powered by WebPlatform.org.

newFeatures.name: Advanced JavaScript Code Intelligence
newFeatures.description: New JavaScript code intelligence based on the Tern project. Increased code hinting accuracy, camelCase support and built-in intelligence for RequireJS and jQuery.

newFeatures.name: Jump To Definition
newFeatures.description: Instantly locate a function or property definition in your project by pressing Ctrl+J or ⌘J.

newFeatures.name: Function Argument / Signature Hints
newFeatures.description: Press Ctrl+Space inside a function call's ()s to see information on its arguments and their types.

newFeatures.name: New Project Panel Design
newFeatures.description: Visual updates to the project panel.

newFeatures.name: Install Extensions From Toolbar
newFeatures.description: Install extensions directly from the toolbar.

newFeatures.name: HTML Highlight w/ Live Preview
newFeatures.description: When in Live Preview mode, place the cursor on an HTML element to highlight that element in the browser. Highlighting can be toggled on/off with Ctrl+Shift+C or ⇧⌘C. Support is currently limited to files with saved changes.

newFeatures.name: New Toolbar
newFeatures.description: A new toolbar is now docked on the right in Brackets. This replaces the top title bar and HTML menus. Icons for Live Preview and other extensions will be found here.

newFeatures.name: New Polish Support and Language Updates
newFeatures.description: A new Polish translation has been created for Brackets. French, German, Czech and Chinese translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: Easier Extension Installation
newFeatures.description: Install extensions in the Brackets UI via File > Install Extensions…. A URL to a ZIP file or GitHub repo is required.

newFeatures.name: Word Wrap
newFeatures.description: Word wrap is now enabled by default. Use the View > Enable Word Wrap menu to toggle.

newFeatures.name: Show Active Line
newFeatures.description: Active line highlighting emphasizes which line the cursor is positioned on. Use the View > Show Active Line menu to toggle.

newFeatures.name: Hide Line Numbers
newFeatures.description: Line numbers can now be hidden. Use the View > Show Line Numbers menu to toggle.

newFeatures.name: Live Development Reliability
newFeatures.description: Improvements and bug fixes were made to make the connection to Chrome more reliable and to report errors more effectively.

newFeatures.name: New/Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: New Chinese translation was added. Also, French, Japanese, German and Italian translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: JavaScript Code Hinting
newFeatures.description: New code hinting for JavaScript includes keywords, local variables, arguments, and property names.

newFeatures.name: Default Live Development on Localhost (w/ Node.js)
newFeatures.description: By default, Live Development uses a built-in webserver powered by node.js.

newFeatures.name: Drag to Dock to Open Files (OSX)
newFeatures.description: Drag a file directly to the Brackets dock icon to open.

newFeatures.name: Drag and Drop to Open Files (Windows)
newFeatures.description: Drag a file directly into Brackets to open.

newFeatures.name: Remember Cursor & Scroll Position
newFeatures.description: Files left open after close will retain cursor and scroll position on launch. During a session, cursor and scroll position is retained for closed files upon reopening.

newFeatures.name: Upgrade to CodeMirror 3
newFeatures.description: The core code editor has been updated to CodeMirror 3, fixing many issues and enabling new functionality.

newFeatures.name: Improved Undo/Redo
newFeatures.description: Undo restores the old selection and cursor position.

newFeatures.name: Line Numbers Always Visible
newFeatures.description: Gutter line numbers stay in view when scrolling horizontally.

newFeatures.name: Double/Triple Click and Drag
newFeatures.description: Double-click-drag and triple-click-drag to select multiple words/lines quickly.

newFeatures.name: Search Improvements
newFeatures.description: All Find results are highlighted when search bar is open. Current result is centered in the editor.

newFeatures.name: Native Menu Bar
newFeatures.description: Menus now appear in the Mac/Windows native menus.

newFeatures.name: CSS Code Hints
newFeatures.description: Code hinting for CSS properties and values now appear for CSS files and <style> blocks.

newFeatures.name: Quick Open and Go to Definition Improvements
newFeatures.description: Result rankings and query response times are improved.

newFeatures.name: Mac Keyboard Shortcut Changes
newFeatures.description: Toggle Block Comment now uses ⌘⌥/. ⌘←, previously used as a Home shortcut, now acts as a Smart Home shortcut. Smart home moves the cursor to the first non-whitespace character on the line.

newFeatures.name: New/Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: New Swedish and Portuguese translations were added. Also, French, Russian, Spanish and Turkish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: CSS/HTML Toggle Comment Improvements
newFeatures.description: Fixed several issues when handling Toggle Line/Block Comment in CSS and HTML files.

newFeatures.name: HTML Attribute Filtering in Code Hints
newFeatures.description: When showing attribute code hints, the existing attributes on the tag are filtered.

newFeatures.name: Rename File in Working Set
newFeatures.description: Clicking on the active file in the working set triggers a file rename.

newFeatures.name: New/Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: A new Russian translation was contributed this sprint. Also, German and Spanish translations have been updated.

newFeatures.name: Inline Color Picker
newFeatures.description: When the cursor is on a hex, rgb() or hsl() color, you can use Ctrl-E or ⌘E to edit the color inline.

newFeatures.name: CSS Highlighting in Live Preview
newFeatures.description: While Live Preview is active, putting the cursor in a rule in a CSS file highlights items affected by that rule in the browser.

newFeatures.name: Block Comment/Uncomment
newFeatures.description: Use Ctrl-Shift-/ or ⌘⇧/ to toggle block comments around the current selection.

newFeatures.name: Find in File or Folder
newFeatures.description: You can now search the contents of a specific file or folder by choosing "Find in…" from the context menu in the file tree.

newFeatures.name: New/Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: A new Turkish translation for Brackets was added and the Japanese, German, Spanish, French and Italian translations were updated, all by community members.

newFeatures.name: URL Mapping for Live Preview
newFeatures.description: You can now use Live Preview with server-based content by specifying a base URL in Project Settings.

newFeatures.name: Extensions Stored Outside of the Application Folder
newFeatures.description: Extensions are now stored per user. Windows: C:\Users\<user>\AppData\Roaming\Brackets\extensions. Mac: /Users/<user>/Library/Application Support/Brackets/extensions.

newFeatures.name: Working Set Sorting and Reordering
newFeatures.description: Sort by name, type or time added by choosing an option from the context menu. Also, the working set may be reordered using drag and drop.

newFeatures.name: New/Updated Translations
newFeatures.description: A new Japanese translation for Brackets was added and the German translation has been updated (both are community contributed).

newFeatures.name: Improved Quick Open
newFeatures.description: Quick Open now searches on the whole path (not just filename), and accepts CamelCase abbreviations and other non-contiguous matches.

newFeatures.name: Status Bar
newFeatures.description: Displays cursor info, file size, file type, JSLint notification, indentation preferences and busy spinner.

newFeatures.name: Indentation Preferences
newFeatures.description: Toggle between indentation via tabs or spaces and set the indentations size from the status bar.

newFeatures.name: Auto Reload in Live Preview
newFeatures.description: Reloads the browser when saving non-CSS files.

newFeatures.name: Resizable Bottom Panels
newFeatures.description: Search Results and JSLint panels can now resize vertically.

newFeatures.name: Incremental Find
newFeatures.description: Highlights the first matching result when typing in the Find dialog.

newFeatures.name: Delete Line
newFeatures.description: Ctrl+Shift+D or ⌘⇧D to delete the current line or lines if there is a selection.

newFeatures.name: Code Hints for Relative URLs
newFeatures.description: href and src attributes show relative paths for files on disk.

newFeatures.name: New Folder
newFeatures.description: Create a new folder using the File > New Folder menu item or when right clicking in the project tree.

newFeatures.name: Rename Files and Folders
newFeatures.description: Right click on a file or folder in the project tree and choose Rename.

newFeatures.name: Show in File Tree
newFeatures.description: Navigate > Show in File Tree menu item will highlight the current file.

newFeatures.name: New Translations
newFeatures.description: Italian and Brazilian Portuguese community contributed translations.

newFeatures.name: New Editor Font: Source Code Pro
newFeatures.description: Brackets now uses a new, open-source monospace font called Source Code Pro.

newFeatures.name: Help Menu
newFeatures.description: Moved Debug menu items "Show Extensions Folder" and "Check for Updates" to a new Help menu.

newFeatures.name: Improved Development Workflow
newFeatures.description: See the brackets-shell README.

newFeatures.name: Finished French Localization
newFeatures.description: Both the application and installers are now localized in French.

newFeatures.name: Version Info
newFeatures.description: Version info can be accessed via the Help > About menu.
